section: Affiliates who use this program to apply for credit cards for their own use are NOT in violation of this Agreement.
explanation: This clause seems to contradict the stated intention of the program being for 'commercial use only' as mentioned in Section 13. Allowing affiliates to personally benefit creates an inconsistency in the purpose of the agreement.

section: Notwithstanding anything set forth in this Agreement, Chase reserves full ownership of the Marks and the Licensed Materials (as defined below). All use of the Marks by Affiliate is limited solely to the use contemplated by this Agreement. All use of Chase Marks by Affiliate is subject to the prior written approval of Chase.
explanation: This section states that 'all use of Chase Marks by Affiliate is subject to the prior written approval of Chase'. However, Section 6 mentions that 'Affiliate may select or remove Links, at any time without prior approval from Chase.' This creates an inconsistency because removing a link with a Chase mark wouldn't reasonably require approval, but this section implies it would.

section: This Agreement will be governed in all respects by the laws of the State of Delaware, including its conflict with law provisions.
explanation: It is structurally flawed to say it will be governed by the laws of the State of Delaware, including its conflict with law provisions, because typically conflict of law provisions are designed to determine which jurisdiction's laws should apply, and explicitly including Delaware's conflicts principles can introduce ambiguity.
